resources.string: App Tracking Protection blocked %1$d tracking attempts in %2$s and %3$d other apps (past hour).
App Tracking Protection is enabled and blocking trackers across your whole device
One easy step for better app privacy!

We found that over 96% of popular free apps allow other companies to track your personal information, even when you‚Äôre sleeping.\n\nSee which apps we catch letting other companies track you and take back control!

App Tracking Protection detects and blocks app trackers from other companies, like when Facebook attempts to track you in a health app.\n\nIt\'s free, and you can enjoy your apps as you normally would. Working in the background, it helps protect you night and day.

App Tracking Protection is not a VPN. However, your device will recognize it as one. This is because it uses a local VPN connection to work.\n\nApp Tracking Protection is different. It never routes app data through an external server. Learn more
Over 96% of popular free apps allow other companies to track you, even when you aren‚Äôt using your phone. App Tracking Protection detects and blocks these tracking attempts.

App Tracking Protection is not a VPN. However, your device will recognize it as one. This is because it uses a local VPN connection to work. It never routes app data through an external server. Learn more
App Tracking Protection shows a real-time list of apps on your device that we catch trying to track you.
You can access App Tracking Protection in Settings.
App Tracking Protection disabled.\nTap to continue blocking tracking attempts across your apps.
A VPN app on your device disabled App Tracking Protection.\nTap to re-enable.
App Tracking Protection is enabled and blocking tracking attempts across your apps.

App Tracking Protection detects and blocks app trackers from other companies, like when Facebook tries to track you in a health app. Companies may still track you in apps they own.\n\nIf an app isn\'t working as expected, try disabling protection for that app.
During beta, DuckDuckGo may disable protection for some apps to resolve known content loading issues. Your custom settings won‚Äôt change unless you restore to default settings.
App Tracking Protection is disabled Did App Tracking Protection cause a problem with your apps Report Issues
Enabling protection sends the app\'s name to DuckDuckGo.
I\'m OK being tracked in this app
Report an Issue With an App
Your custom protection settings will update to our latest default protections. You can always change your protection settings again later.
Enabling protection sends the app\'s name to DuckDuckGo.
Select the app experiencing the issue. Your feedback really helps us improve!\n\nHave general feedback about App Tracking Protection? Use this form instead.

string.name: atp_ReportBreakageAppEntry
string.instruction: Placeholder is the name of an app

resources.string: Please describe what\'s happening, what you expected to happen, and steps that led to the issue.
Tell us more about the issue you\'re experiencing
By clicking ‚ÄúSubmit‚Äù I agree that DuckDuckGo may use the information in this report for purposes of improving App Tracking Protection.

In addition to the details entered into this form, your app issue report will contain:
• The app package name
• A list of trackers blocked in the app
• Whether App Tracking Protection is enabled
• Aggregate DuckDuckGo app diagnostics
Report sent, thanks! Your feedback helps us improve App Tracking Protection for everyone.

You\‚Äôve probably heard about companies like Google and Facebook tracking you behind the scenes on third-party websites. But did you know they also track your personal information through apps on your device?

Over 96\% of the 100 popular free Android apps we tested contained hidden third-party trackers. Of those, 87\% sent data to Google and 68\% sent data to Facebook. This happens even when you\‚Äôre not using your device.

Trackers in apps may have access to a lot more information than their website tracker cousins, such as your location down to which floor of a building you're on, how often you play games while at work, and when and how long you sleep each day. Even if you don't have a Google or Facebook account, for example, they can still collect data about you from your apps.

Tracking networks like Facebook and Google use these little pieces of information to build a digital profile about you. With it, tracking networks can manipulate what you see online and allow advertisers to bid on access to you based on your data.

Trackers in apps is a BIG problem for privacy. But DuckDuckGo has a solution that can help.

When enabled in the DuckDuckGo Privacy Browser app, App Tracking Protection blocks many trackers in other apps on your device, at the same time that the DuckDuckGo app blocks trackers we find on websites when you browse. These dual layers of protection reduce what tracking companies know about you overall, so you can use your apps with more peace of mind, knowing you\‚Äôre more protected.
Report a problem With an App

resources.string: This feature is in beta. Notice a problem with an app? Please report an issue.
App Tracking Protection is disabled\nDid App Tracking Protection cause a problem with your apps? Report Issues
Android disabled App Tracking Protection. Want to prevent this happening again? Re-enable
A VPN app on your device disabled App Tracking Protection.\nDid App Tracking Protection cause a problem with your apps? Report Issues
How does App Tracking Protection work?
App Tracking Protection blocks known app trackers from other companies, like when Facebook tries to track you in a health app. Companies may still track you in apps they own.
Does App Tracking Protection block trackers in all my apps?

Protection may be automatically disabled for certain apps, like those that load websites, so that content appears normally. For apps with known issues, this is mostly temporary as we work to improve App Tracking Protection. You can manage this protection for each app on your device in the settings.

In addition, some trackers may not be blocked because we haven't yet detected and added them to our blocklist. We are continually working to identify and protect against new trackers, so you can rest easy knowing you're getting the most up-to-date protection.

You can expect updates to our tracker list every few months. These updates will get applied on your device automatically
Why does App Tracking Protection use a VPN connection?

You‚Äôll be asked to set up a virtual private network (VPN) connection, but you don\'t need to install a VPN app for App Tracking Protection to work.\n\nThis permission allows App Tracking Protection, which works locally on your device, to monitor network traffic so that it can block known trackers.
Will App Tracking Protection work if I also use a VPN app?

Android only allows one active VPN connection at a time. That means you can\‚Äôt use App Tracking Protection while a VPN app on your device is running or set to ‚ÄúAlways on.‚Äù\n\nWe recommend that you enable App Tracking Protection when you are not using a VPN app Just make sure your VPN app isn‚Äôt set to "always-on". Go to Android Network settings > VPN. Then, check the gear icon for any listed VPN apps and disable"always-on." Some VPN apps may also have an auto-connect setting which must be disabled.
How is App Tracking Protection different from a VPN?

A VPN sends your data from the device to its own server, where it secures and anonymizes your data from prying eyes. However, this allows the VPN company to see your network traffic.

App Tracking Protection is different. Instead of sending your data to a VPN server, App Tracking Protection works locally on your device, sitting between your apps and the servers they talk to.

Whenever App Tracking Protection recognizes a known tracker, it blocks the tracker from sending personal information (such as your IP address, activity, and device details) off your device. All other traffic reaches its destination, so your apps work normally.
App Tracking Protection works on your device and doesn‚Äôt send your personal data off your device to DuckDuckGo.
Your App Tracking Protection Invitation is Here!
You joined the waitlist and asked us to notify you when it\'s your turn to try our App Tracking Protection feature. Tap to view your invitation.
One easy step for better app privacy!
Block trackers we find hiding in your other apps and see who was trying to track you.\nLearn more
Block trackers we find hiding in your other apps and see who was trying to track you.\n\nLearn more about the beta
We didn\'t recognise this Invite Code.

You won‚Äôt need to share any personal information to join the waitlist. You‚Äôll secure your place in line with a timestamp that exists solely on your device so we can notify you when it‚Äôs your turn.
An error happened while joining the Waitlist, please try again later
We\'ll send you a notification when App Tracking Protection is ready for you.\n\nLearn more about the beta

Your invite to try App Tracking Protection will arrive here. Check back soon, or we can send you a notification when it‚Äôs your turn

If you noticed a problem with a specific app, you can manage protection for that app instead.
Your VPN app may be disconnected
Your VPN app is blocking App Tracking Protection
Android only allows one active VPN connection at a time. Enabling App Tracking Protection may disconnect any active VPN on your device.
Android only allows one active VPN connection at a time. Open Network settings > VPN. Find the VPN app that‚Äôs ‚Äúalways-on‚Äù and disable it to continue.
If you‚Äôre having problems with an app (such as content not loading), try disabling protection for that app and submit a report.
App Tracking Protection will be disabled and any settings and history of tracking attempts will be deleted. You can enable it again at any time in Settings.
Go to your device‚Äôs VPN Settings for DuckDuckGo and enable Always-on VPN to prevent Android disabling protection.\n\nMake sure to leave the other setting OFF.
To avoid app issues, go to your device\'s VPN Settings for DuckDuckGo and disable Block connections without VPN
Action required! To avoid app issues, you need to change your Android settings. Change settings
Action required! An Android setting needs to be changed for App Tracking Protection.
